sections.title: Installing the FTC SDK (OnBot Java)
sections.content:
OnBot Java is a web-based development environment built into the Control Hub and Expansion Hub. The FTC SDK is pre-installed and always up to date on these devices.

This means you do not need to manually install or update the SDK when using OnBot Java. You simply connect to the Control Hub's WiFi, open a browser, and start programming.

- FTC Docs: OnBot Java Setup
- gm0: OnBot Java Setup

sections.title: OnBot Java Setup Steps
items: Connect your computer or tablet to the Control Hub's WiFi network.
Open a browser and go to http://192.168.43.1:8080 (default address).
Click 'OnBot Java' in the Robot Controller app.
Create or edit your OpModes directly in the browser.
No manual SDK installation is required.

sections.title: Installing the FTC SDK (Android Studio)
sections.content:
If you use Android Studio for advanced development, you must download and import the FTC SDK. This gives you more control and access to advanced features, but requires a few extra steps.

- FTC Docs: Android Studio Setup
- gm0: Android Studio Setup

sections.title: Android Studio Setup Steps
items: Clone or download the FTC SDK from FTC SDK GitHub.
Open the project in Android Studio.
Connect your Control Hub/Expansion Hub via USB or WiFi.
Build and deploy your code from Android Studio.

sections.title: Example: Importing the SDK in Android Studio
sections.content:
After cloning the SDK, open the project in Android Studio. You will see two main modules: FtcRobotController (the app that runs on the robot) and TeamCode (where you write your code).

You can add new OpModes in the TeamCode module.

sections.title: Sample build.gradle (TeamCode module)
Hardware & Network Configuration
sections.content:
Before you can run code, you must configure your robot hardware using the Robot Controller app.

- Set up your hardware configuration file and name each device.
- Make sure your Driver Station is connected to the same WiFi network as the Control Hub.
- For troubleshooting, see gm0: Control Hub Troubleshooting.

sections.title: Best Practices for SDK Installation
sections.subtitle: Follow these tips:
items: Use the latest stable version of the SDK.
Test your setup with a simple OpMode.
Keep backup copies of working configurations.
